title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 68.2 - How proceeding to be commenced
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 68.2 - How proceeding to be commenced

State Regulations
(a) After objection to registration is filed (see section
68.1
[c]
of this

Part), or if revocation of a registered device is sought, such proceeding is
initiated by the filing of a petition with the board. Thereafter, a hearing is
held at which interested parties are afforded full opportunity to present any
evidence which may be relevant or have a bearing upon the issues raised in the
petition. (b) A proceeding under
this Part shall be commenced by filing with the board, at its Albany office, a
petition executed in accordance with the provisions of Part 6 5 of this

Subchapter. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
68.2

Amended

New

York State Register March 30, 2022/Volume XLIV, Issue 13, eff. 3/30/2022

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
